maml:description.maml:para: Sets your API key used to authenticate all API calls.

The Add-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet sets your API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to MyITProcess. Once the API key is defined by Add-MyITProcessAPIKey, it is encrypted using SecureString.
The MyITProcess API keys are generated via the MyITProcess web interface at Organization Settings > API Keys.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the API Key
The MyITProcess API will use the string entered into the [ -Api_Key ] parameter.
The Add-MyITProcessAPIKey function will use the string passed into it as its API key.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the MyITProcess API connection.
The Add-MyITProcessBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1 which is MyITProcess's default URI.
The base URI will use https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1 which is MyITProcess's default URI.
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.example.com will be used for all API calls to MyITProcess's reporting API.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the saved MyITProcess configuration settings
The Get-MyITProcessModuleSettings cmdlet gets the saved MyITProcess configuration settings
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the contents of the configuration file that was created with the Export-MyITProcessModuleSettings
The default location of the MyITProcess configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI\config.psd1
Opens the configuration file from the defined location in the default editor
The location of the MyITProcess configuration file in this example is: C:\MyITProcessAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the MyITProcess API key global variable.
The Get-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet gets the MyITProcess API key global variable and returns it as a SecureString.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the MyITProcess API key global variable and returns it as a SecureString.

maml:description.maml:para: Shows the MyITProcess base URI global variable.
The Get-MyITProcessBaseURI cmdlet shows the MyITProcess base URI global variable value.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Shows the MyITProcess base URI global variable value.

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all clients (both active and inactive)
The Get-MyITProcessClients cmdlet lists all clients (both active and inactive)

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 clients
Returns the clients whose name equals the defined condition
Returns the first 100 clients sorted by name in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List all findings
The Get-MyITProcessFindings cmdlet list all findings
Findings are located under Strategy > Client > Menu > Initiatives

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 findings
Returns the findings whose name contains the defined condition
Returns the first 100 findings sorted by review.name in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of initiatives
The Get-MyITProcessInitiatives cmdlet gets a list of initiatives
Initiatives are located under Strategy > Client > Menu > Initiatives

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 initiatives
Returns the initiatives whose client.id equals the defined condition
Returns the first 100 initiatives sorted by client.id in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of meetings
The Get-MyITProcessMeetings cmdlet gets a list of meetings
Meetings are located under Strategy > Client > Menu > Meeting History

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 meetings
Returns the meetings whose title equals the defined condition
Returns the first 100 meetings sorted by title in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of recommendations
The Get-MyITProcessRecommendations cmdlet gets a list of recommendations
Meetings are located under Strategy > Client > Menu > Recommendation backlog

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 recommendations
Returns the recommendations whose name contains the defined condition
Returns the first 100 recommendations sorted by name in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of reviews
The Get-MyITProcessReviews cmdlet gets a list of reviews

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 reviews
Returns the first 100 overdue reviews
Returns the reviews whose name contains the defined condition
Returns the first 100 reviews sorted by name in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of users
The Get-MyITProcessUsers cmdlet gets a List of users

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 users
Returns the users whose firstName equals the defined condition
Returns the first 100 users sorted by firstName in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: Imports the MyITProcess BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to the current session.
The Import-MyITProcessModuleSettings cmdlet imports the MyITProcess BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information stored in the MyITProcess configuration file to the users current session.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-MyITProcessModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.
The default location of the MyITProcess configuration file is: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI\config.psd1
Validates that the configuration file created with the Export-MyITProcessModuleSettings cmdlet exists then imports the stored data into the current users session.
The location of the MyITProcess configuration file in this example is: C:\MyITProcessAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the MyITProcess API key global variable.
The Remove-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet removes the MyITProcess API key global variable.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the MyITProcess API key global variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the MyITProcess base URI global variable.
The Remove-MyITProcessBaseURI cmdlet removes the MyITProcess base URI global variable.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Removes the MyITProcess base URI global variable.

maml:description.maml:para: Removes the stored MyITProcess configuration folder.
The Remove-MyITProcessModuleSettings cmdlet removes the MyITProcess folder and its files. This cmdlet also has the option to remove sensitive MyITProcess variables as well.
By default configuration files are stored in the following location and will be removed: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI

dev:remarks.maml:para: Checks to see if the default configuration folder exists and removes it if it does.
The default location of the MyITProcess configuration folder is: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI
Checks to see if the defined configuration folder exists and removes it if it does. If sensitive MyITProcess variables exist then they are removed as well.
The location of the MyITProcess configuration folder in this example is: C:\MyITProcessAPI

maml:description.maml:para: Sets your API key used to authenticate all API calls.

The Add-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet sets your API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to MyITProcess. Once the API key is defined by Add-MyITProcessAPIKey, it is encrypted using SecureString.
The MyITProcess API keys are generated via the MyITProcess web interface at Organization Settings > API Keys.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the API Key
The MyITProcess API will use the string entered into the [ -Api_Key ] parameter.
The Add-MyITProcessAPIKey function will use the string passed into it as its API key.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the MyITProcess API connection.
The Add-MyITProcessBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls.

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1 which is MyITProcess's default URI.
The base URI will use https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1 which is MyITProcess's default URI.
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.example.com will be used for all API calls to MyITProcess's reporting API.

maml:description.maml:para: Test the MyITProcess API key.
The Test-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-MyITProcessBaseURI & Add-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlets.
This functions validates authorization to the /users endpoint

dev:remarks.maml:para: Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-MyITProcessBaseURI & Add-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlets.
The default full base uri test path is: https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/api/v1/clients
Tests the base URI & API key that was defined in the Add-MyITProcessBaseURI & Add-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlets.
The full base uri test path in this example is: http://myapi.gateway.example.com/clients

maml:description.maml:para: Lists all clients (both active and inactive)
The Get-MyITProcessClients cmdlet lists all clients (both active and inactive)
Filter by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'name', 'createdDate', 'isActive', 'deactivatedDate', 'lastReviewDate', 'lastAssignedMemberActivityDate', 'alignmentScore'
Filter by a specific field predicate operator
Allowed values: 'equal', 'notEqual', 'greaterThan', 'lessThan', 'contains'
Filter by a value in the specified field.
This value cannot be empty
Also filter for other values
Allowed values: 'and', 'or', $null
This parameter is just a placeholder for now as I am unsure how to add this functionality if multiple queries are needed
Sort by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'name', 'createdDate', 'isActive', 'deactivatedDate', 'lastReviewDate', 'lastAssignedMemberActivityDate', 'alignmentScore'
Sort the specific field name in a certain direction
Allowed values: 'asc', 'desc'
Defines the page number to return
[Default] 1
Defines the number of items to return with each page
[Default] 100 [Maximum] 100
Returns all items from an endpoint

maml:description.maml:para: Sets your API key used to authenticate all API calls.

The Add-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet sets your API key which is used to authenticate all API calls made to MyITProcess. Once the API key is defined by Add-MyITProcessAPIKey, it is encrypted using SecureString.
The MyITProcess API keys are generated via the MyITProcess web interface at Organization Settings > API Keys.
Define your API key that was generated from MyITProcess.
Define your API key that was generated from MyITProcess.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Prompts to enter in the API Key
The MyITProcess API will use the string entered into the [ -Api_Key ] parameter.
The Add-MyITProcessAPIKey function will use the string passed into it as its API key.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the base URI for the MyITProcess API connection.
The Add-MyITProcessBaseURI cmdlet sets the base URI which is later used to construct the full URI for all API calls.
Define the base URI for the MyITProcess API connection using MyITProcess's URI or a custom URI.
MyITProcess's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers. The accepted values for this parameter are: [ US ] US = https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1
Define the base URI for the MyITProcess API connection using MyITProcess's URI or a custom URI.
MyITProcess's URI connection point that can be one of the predefined data centers. The accepted values for this parameter are: [ US ] US = https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1

dev:remarks.maml:para: The base URI will use https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1 which is MyITProcess's default URI.
The base URI will use https://reporting.live.myitprocess.com/public-api/v1 which is MyITProcess's default URI.
A custom API gateway of http://myapi.gateway.example.com will be used for all API calls to MyITProcess's reporting API.

maml:description.maml:para: Converts uri filter parameters
The Invoke-MyITProcessRequest cmdlet converts & formats uri filter parameters from a function which are later used to make the full resource uri for an API call
This is an internal helper function the ties in directly with the Invoke-MyITProcessRequest & any public functions that define parameters
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Hashtable of values to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
Defines the short resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call

dev:remarks.maml:para: Example: (From public function) $uri_Filter = @{}
ForEach ( $Key in $PSBoundParameters.GetEnumerator() ){ if( $excludedParameters -contains $Key.Key ){$null} else{ $uri_Filter += @{ $Key.Key = $Key.Value } } }
1x key = https://MyITProcessapi.us1.my.MyITProcess.com/v1/account?accountId=12345 2x key = https://MyITProcessapi.us1.my.MyITProcess.com/v1/account?accountId=12345&details=True

maml:description.maml:para: Exports the MyITProcess BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file.
The Export-MyITProcessModuleSettings cmdlet exports the MyITProcess BaseURI, API, & JSON configuration information to file.

Making use of PowerShell's System.Security.SecureString type, exporting module settings encrypts your API key in a format that can only be unencrypted with the your Windows account as this encryption is tied to your user principal. This means that you cannot copy your configuration file to another computer or user account and expect it to work.
Define the location to store the MyITProcess configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI
Define the name of the MyITProcess configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1
Define the location to store the MyITProcess configuration file.
By default the configuration file is stored in the following location: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI
Define the name of the MyITProcess configuration file.
By default the configuration file is named: config.psd1

dev:remarks.maml:para: Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's MyITProcess configuration file located at: $env:USERPROFILE\MyITProcessAPI\config.psd1
Validates that the BaseURI, API, and JSON depth are set then exports their values to the current user's MyITProcess configuration file located at: C:\MyITProcessAPI\MyConfig.psd1

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the MyITProcess API key global variable.
The Get-MyITProcessAPIKey cmdlet gets the MyITProcess API key global variable and returns it as a SecureString.
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text.
Decrypt and return the API key in plain text.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the MyITProcess API key global variable and returns it as a SecureString.

maml:description.maml:para: Makes an API request
The Invoke-MyITProcessRequest cmdlet invokes an API request to MyITProcess API.
This is an internal function that is used by all public functions
As of 2023-08 the MyITProcess v1 API only supports GET requests
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-MyITProcessQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $MyITProcess_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-MyITProcessQueryString
Place holder parameter to use when other methods are supported by the MyITProcess v1 API
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters
Defines the type of API method to use
Allowed values: 'GET'
Defines the resource uri (url) to use when creating the API call
Used with the internal function [ ConvertTo-MyITProcessQueryString ] to combine a functions parameters with the resource_Uri parameter.
This allows for the full uri query to occur
The full resource path is made with the following data $MyITProcess_Base_URI + $resource_Uri + ConvertTo-MyITProcessQueryString
Place holder parameter to use when other methods are supported by the MyITProcess v1 API
Returns all items from an endpoint
When using this parameter there is no need to use either the page or perPage parameters

dev:remarks.maml:para: Invoke a rest method against the defined resource using any of the provided parameters
Example: Name Value ---- ----- Method GET Uri https://MyITProcessapi.us1.my.MyITProcess.com/v1/account?accountId=12345&details=True Headers {Authorization = Bearer 123456789} Body

maml:description.maml:para: List of meetings
The Get-MyITProcessMeetings cmdlet gets a list of meetings
Meetings are located under Strategy > Client > Menu > Meeting History
Filter by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'status', 'title', 'purpose', 'startDate', 'endDate', 'location', 'summaryDescription', 'recommendationIds', 'client.id', 'client.name', 'createdBy.id', 'createdBy.fullName'
Filter by a specific field predicate operator
Allowed values: 'equal', 'notEqual', 'greaterThan', 'lessThan', 'contains'
Filter by a value in the specified field.
This value cannot be empty
Also filter for other values
Allowed values: 'and', 'or', $null
This parameter is just a placeholder for now as I am unsure how to add this functionality if multiple queries are needed
Sort by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'status', 'title', 'purpose', 'startDate', 'endDate', 'location', 'summaryDescription', 'recommendationIds', 'client.id', 'client.name', 'createdBy.id', 'createdBy.fullName'
Sort the specific field name in a certain direction
Allowed values: 'asc', 'desc'
Defines the page number to return
[Default] 1
Defines the number of items to return with each page
[Default] 100 [Maximum] 100
Returns all items from an endpoint
Filter by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'status', 'title', 'purpose', 'startDate', 'endDate', 'location', 'summaryDescription', 'recommendationIds', 'client.id', 'client.name', 'createdBy.id', 'createdBy.fullName'
Filter by a specific field predicate operator
Allowed values: 'equal', 'notEqual', 'greaterThan', 'lessThan', 'contains'
Filter by a value in the specified field.
This value cannot be empty
Also filter for other values
Allowed values: 'and', 'or', $null
This parameter is just a placeholder for now as I am unsure how to add this functionality if multiple queries are needed
Sort by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'status', 'title', 'purpose', 'startDate', 'endDate', 'location', 'summaryDescription', 'recommendationIds', 'client.id', 'client.name', 'createdBy.id', 'createdBy.fullName'
Sort the specific field name in a certain direction
Allowed values: 'asc', 'desc'
Defines the page number to return
[Default] 1
Defines the number of items to return with each page
[Default] 100 [Maximum] 100
Returns all items from an endpoint

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 meetings
Returns the meetings whose title equals the defined condition
Returns the first 100 meetings sorted by title in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of recommendations
The Get-MyITProcessRecommendations cmdlet gets a list of recommendations
Meetings are located under Strategy > Client > Menu > Recommendation backlog
Defines the recommendation id that in turn will show you any linked configurations
This is a required parameter.
Filter by a specific field name

Allowed values: 'id', 'parentId', 'client.id', 'client.name', 'initiative.id', 'name', 'description', 'budget', 'budgetMonth', 'hours', 'type', 'responsibleParty', 'status', 'priority', 'isArchived', 'recommendationFeedback', 'findingsIds'
Filter by a specific field predicate operator
Allowed values: 'equal', 'notEqual', 'greaterThan', 'lessThan', 'contains'
Filter by a value in the specified field.
This value cannot be empty
Also filter for other values
Allowed values: 'and', 'or', $null
This parameter is just a placeholder for now as I am unsure how to add this functionality if multiple queries are needed
Sort by a specific field name

Allowed values: 'id', 'parentId', 'client.id', 'client.name', 'initiative.id', 'name', 'description', 'budget', 'budgetMonth', 'hours', 'type', 'responsibleParty', 'status', 'priority', 'isArchived', 'recommendationFeedback', 'findingsIds'
Sort the specific field name in a certain direction
Allowed values: 'asc', 'desc'
Defines the page number to return
[Default] 1
Defines the number of items to return with each page
[Default] 100 [Maximum] 100
Returns all items from an endpoint

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 recommendations
Returns the recommendations whose name contains the defined condition
Returns the first 100 recommendations sorted by name in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2

maml:description.maml:para: List of reviews
The Get-MyITProcessReviews cmdlet gets a list of reviews
Returns a list of categories up for review
Filter by a specific field name
Allowed values: 'id', 'name', 'status', 'assignedEngineer.id', 'assignedEngineer.fullName', 'assignedVCIO.id', 'assignedVCIO.fullName', 'createdDate', 'lastUpdatedDate', 'client.id', 'client.name'
Filter by a specific field predicate operator
Allowed values: 'equal', 'notEqual', 'greaterThan', 'lessThan', 'contains'
Filter by a value in the specified field.
This value cannot be empty
Also filter for other values
Allowed values: 'and', 'or', $null
This parameter is just a placeholder for now as I am unsure how to add this functionality if multiple queries are needed

Sort the specific field name in a certain direction
Allowed values: 'asc', 'desc'
Defines the page number to return
[Default] 1
Defines the number of items to return with each page
[Default] 100 [Maximum] 100
Returns all items from an endpoint

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the first 100 reviews
Returns the first 100 overdue reviews
Returns the reviews whose name contains the defined condition
Returns the first 100 reviews sorted by name in descending order
Returns results 50 at a time and outputs data from page 2
